data.title: Pranjal Chalise Felicitated as Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021
data.snippet:
# Pranjal Chalise Felicitated as Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021

Nepal News Agency

Shares

Share

Tweet

Share

Kathmandu. Mr. Pranjal Chalise,19 years old Technopreneur from Kathmandu has been awarded the title of ‚ÄúWai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021‚Äù amidst a Virtual Award ceremony organized by Glocal Pvt. Ltd today.

It is the seventh iteration of the Glocal Teen Hero Award, which is the only national platform in Nepal to identify and honor outstanding teenagers whose creativity, commitment, experience, and strong leadership have helped them achieve success in life. [...] The finalists were individually interviewed by the panel of judges comprising of H.E. Ms. Nona Deprez, the Ambassador of Delegation of the European Union to Nepal, Ms. Vidushi Rana, Director of Marketing, Branding and Business Development at Gold Star shoes, Mr. Varun Chaudhary, Managing Director of CG Corp Global, Mr. Adarsh Avasthi, Country Director of the Coca-Cola Company for Nepal and Mr. Saurabh Jyoti, Director of Jyoti Group of Companiesand today, Mr. Chalise was officially declared and awarded as Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021 virtually amidst the awarding ceremony.

This year Glocal has partnered with Wai Wai as a Title Partner; Embassy of India, UNESCO and European Union as Strategic Partner, The Soaltee Hotel as Official Hotel Partner. [...] These teenagers were selected from a pool of 611 applications from across the nation, by our respected jury panel through an intense selection round for the impacts they have created in society.

The applicants had demonstrated their skills and expertise, and made an impact in their society, from areas like academia, social work, literature, entrepreneurship, computer programming, innovation, and environmental conservation.

This award recognizes and honors the exceptional teen whose work is sustainable and who can think out of the box addressing the issues and creating an impact in society.

data.title: Technopreneur Pranjal becomes Teen Hero Nepal 2021 - Mod Dhakal
data.snippet:
# Mod Dhakal

Freedom of expression is at the heart of human civilization!

## Saturday, September 4, 2021

### Technopreneur Pranjal becomes Teen Hero Nepal 2021

Kathmandu, Sept. 3

Pranjal Chalise, 19 years old Technopreneur from Kathmandu, has won the ‚ÄòWai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021‚Äô award.

The organiser Glocal Pvt. Ltd. organised a virtual award ceremony the other evening to announce the award.

Chalise was selected among the top six finanlists - Anurag Chapagain, 18, Youtuber, from Nawalparasi, Deepak Sutihar, 19, Social Entrepreneur from Saptari, Khusbu Bhandari, 18, Wildlife Conservationist from Chitwan, Neha Gurung, 19, Social Activist from Kathmandu and Sabhya Rai, 19, Education Activist from IIam. [...] Furthermore, he is the member of the board of Initiative in Nepal Foundation, and currently working on a research paper about the Blockchain Technology and Smart Contracts and the ways in which technological advancement can mitigate the costs of elongated transaction processes.

The organiser said that it was the seventh iteration of the Glocal Teen Hero Award, which is the only national platform in Nepal to identify and honour outstanding teenagers whose creativity, commitment, experience, and strong leadership have helped them achieve success in life.

About 611 teenagers had applied for the competition. [...] Chalise has aided the blind community by inventing Drishti Nepal, which helps visually impaired people in currency bills recognition and cash transactions.

Likewise, he has developed a mobile application that provides agricultural news and information from authentic sources. His another app is a Women Safety app to ensure the security of women and ensure they are not deprived of opportunities due to their safety reasons.

His other two educational apps have 7,500 users.

Chalise has also initiated a non-profit tech venture E-educators Nepal, which enhances the quality of online education and makes educational resources more accessible.

data.title: [PDF] Yearly Report- 2021 - Glocal Pvt. Ltd.
data.snippet: Srilanka Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021 Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021 was held virtually on September 1, 2021. Everything was conducted online, from the start of the application until the recognition of teens. In the first round, a virtual press conference and a call for applications were held. Following that, virtual activation was held in over 200 schools in order to reach out to teenagers and provide information about Glocal Teen Hero. Glocal's 20under20 were chosen and the top six finalists were announced. Those finalists were nurtured and trained in virtual Self Competency Development session. On the last day of the event, one fantastic teen was awarded as Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal at Virtual Award Gala. Mr. Pranjal Chalise, 19 years old technopreneur won the title of [...] continuously adding value to the society by recognizing and empowering amazing teenagers as future change-makers. Glocal Teen Hero 2021- Winners NEPAL Pranjal Chalise 19 years old Technopreneur INDIA Radhika Gupta 16 years old Educationist SRI LANKA Sachintha Chamaranga Abeyrathne 18 years old Social Entrepreneur Glocal Annual Report ‚Äì 2021 Glocal International Teen Conference 2021 Glocal International Teen Conference (GITC) is an amazing platform for passionate teenagers from around the globe to share their insights, initiation, and perspectives to bring impact in the society and respectively in the world. The conference aims to address the issues and overcome the barriers by boosting leadership, empowerment, and social impact through a participatory and interactive environment with [...] Glocal Annual Report ‚Äì 2021 Year Name Title Address 2015 Ms. Bipana Sharma Child Right Activist Nawalparasi. Nepal 2016 Mr. Santosh Lamichhane Mechanical Enthusiast Lalitpur, Nepal 2017 Mr. Sachin Dangi Social Worker/ Activist Dang, Nepal 2018 Ms. Prashansha KC Social Activist/ YouTuber Rukum, Nepal 2019 Mr. Samir Phuyal Entrepreneur Morang, Nepal Mr. Monishwaran Maheswaran Innovator Bangalore, India 2020 Ms. Mandira Shrestha Health Activist Ramechhap, Nepal Mr. Vivaan Kabir Youth Activist Mumbai, India Ms. Menuri Sachintha Activist Madapatha, Sri Lanka 2021 Ms. Pranjal Chalise Technopreneur Kathmandu, Nepal Ms. Radhika Gupta Educationist Uttar Pradesh, India Mr. Sachintha Chamaranga Abeyrathne Social Entrepreneur Piliyandala, Srilanka Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021 Wai Wai Glocal

data.title: Six Finalists Announced for Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021
data.snippet:
1. Anurag Chapagain‚Äì GTH<space>AC send it to 33001
2. Deepak Sutihar‚Äì GTH<space>DS send it to 33001
3. Khusbu Bhandari‚Äì GTH<space>KB send it to 33001
4. Neha Gurung‚Äì GTH<space>NG send it to 33001
5. Pranjal Chalise‚Äì GTH<space>PC send it to 33001
6. Sabhya Rai‚Äì GTH<space>SR send it to 33001

Award gala ceremony of the Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2020 will be held virtually on 1st of September, 2021 in the presence of different personalities of Nepal from different sectors such as diplomats, politicians, academia, film stars, entrepreneurs, youth leaders and many more. [...] Mr. Anurag Chapagain, (18 years, Youtuber, Nawalparasi); Mr. Deepak Sutihar (19 years, Social Entrepreneur, Saptari); Ms. Khusbu Bhandari, (18 years,Wildlife Conservationist, Chitwan); Ms. Neha Gurung, (19 years, Social Activist, Kathmandu); Mr. Pranjal Chalise, (19 years, Technopreneur, Kathmandu) and Ms. Sabhya Rai, (19 years, Education Activist, IIam) have been selected as top 6 finalists for the competition, the only national platform in Nepal to recognize and honor the outstanding teenagers.

From the top 20 teenagers & their document review; Top Six Finalists was shortlisted for the final round of Glocal Teen Hero Nepal based on initiation and their impact of work.

data.title: Pranjal Chalise: An Enthusiastic Technopreneur! - Glocal Teen Hero
data.snippet:
Pranjal has aided the Blind Community by inventing Drishti Nepal, which helps the blind community in currency bills recognition and cash transactions. By creating Kisan Nepal, a mobile application that offers agricultural news and information from reliable sources and keeps farmers informed and alert, he has helped to alleviate agricultural and farmer limitations. 

Currently, He is working as an incubator and app developer at Incubate Nepal. He is recognized as one of the brightest high school students (One of 20 selected students from all disciplines and one of 10 for Computer Science) from all over Nepal to work on open-end research projects under the mentorship of MIT and Harvard graduates. [...] Besides this; He is also working in BloomED (Bloom School Nepal), a non-profit educational and academic resource platform. He has been working as a content creation intern and contributed in drafting the educational resources that will be distributed to many students in disadvantage.

In the future, he envisions himself honing and upgrading talents, investing heavily in intensive training to obtain more advanced technology skills so that he may best serve the community.

##### Pranjal Chalise has been selected as a ‚ÄúGlocal‚Äôs 20under20 of 2021 Batch‚Äù as an early change-maker throughout the nation. Glocal‚Äôs 20 under 20 is an umbrella title for 20 early change-makers, who are teenagers from diverse fields, stepping out to create an impact in the society.

###### Next Post [...] Apart from that; He is the founder & Project Mentor of Students Research Council Nepal (SRCN), (an organization that provides the platform of research and project-based education to high-school enthusiasts and provides paper-writing and app development training). He finished the initial round of research and launched Gyan-E, Nepal‚Äôs first-ever discussion forum. They have guided 7 brilliant high schoolers under his mentorship. In the International Journal, SRCN has successfully published 4 research papers.

As a Computer Science Mentor, he taught coding and mobile app development to high school students. His work has been recognized by the Nepal Academy of Science and Technology for their efforts to introduce the concept of research and instill it in young students.
